Finally we were able to obtain a research/personal-use-only license 
(which=
 includes rights to distribute derivatives publicly for no 
profit) for rtN=
EAT from UT Austin:

http://nn.cs.utexas.edu/keyword?rtneat

In principle, =
this means anyone can now use this code to make a game 
like NERO, or not l=
ike NERO, or not a game :)  

For those not familiar with rtNEAT, you can f=
ollow the paper links 
from the link above to read more.  In short, rtNEAT =
lets you run NEAT 
in real-time simulations and games with the whole popula=
tion evolving 
on the screen at the same time.  

Have fun!

ken
